page.title: 04CRACKLEY WOODS
page.content: Crackley Wood is situated just outside Kenilworth. It covers 60 acres. A disused railway track runs through the wood on an embankment. There are many trees and animals of which you can see the prints. There is a clearing in which are picnic tables. There is an old railway bridge. The footpaths get very muddy in winter, and the roots of trees trip you up. The many small ponds and ditches are mostly full of mud. There is a fence which has narrow entances to stop horses. There are horse and dog droppings everywhere. There are lots of small ferns and fungi. A road runs beside the wood with lay-bys here and there where you can park. In the spring the bluebells are in flower and the woods are very pretty.
